Class CourseSchedule

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractSet<E>
        • java.util.HashSet<Course>
          • CourseSchedule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<Course>, Collection<Course>, Set<Course>

    public class CourseSchedule
extends HashSet<Course>
    Defines a number of courses that, taken together, form a schedule.
    Author:
    Calvin Cheng
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructs an empty course schedule.
      CourseSchedule(Collection<Course> schedule)
      Constructs a schedule specified by the given list of courses.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CourseSchedule

        public CourseSchedule()
        Constructs an empty course schedule.

      • CourseSchedule

        public CourseSchedule(Collection<Course> schedule)
        Constructs a schedule specified by the given list of courses.
        Parameters:
        schedule - A list of courses to form the schedule.

    • Method Detail

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Determines whether the schedule is a valid schedule. That is, this method returns true if and only if none of the times of the courses conflict with each other and all of the necessary pre-requisites and co-requisites are met.
        Returns:
        true if the schedule is valid; false otherwise.
